active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the real-world implications of the CVSS UI metric: Should vulnerabilities requiring Active user interaction (e.g., phishing clicks) be deprioritized compared to those with None? Use examples from recent CVEs like Log4Shell or WannaCry to support your arguments, considering exploitability and threat modeling.

active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

Generate 25 high-quality flashcards in JSON array: [{'front': '...', 'back': {'answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'distractors': ['D1','D2','D3'], 'source': '...', 'bloom_level': '...', 'layer': 1}}, ...]. Follow exact schema. Ensure accuracy: Focus ONLY on CVSS UI, not general human-centric security. Use real CVEs (e.g., Log4Shell UI:Passive). Distractors per protocol.
